get.description: Returns a paginated list of works

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page to return from the result list

parameters.name: pageSize
parameters.description: The number of works to return per page (default: 10)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description:
Full-text search query, which will OR supplied terms by default.

The following special characters can be used to change the search behaviour:

- \+ signifies AND operation
- | signifies OR operation
- \- negates a single token
- " wraps a number of tokens to signify a phrase for searching
- \* at the end of a term signifies a prefix query
- ( and ) signify precedence
- ~N after a word signifies edit distance (fuzziness)
- ~N after a phrase signifies slop amount

To search for any of these special characters, they should be escaped with \.

parameters.description: A comma-separated list of extra fields to include

contributors.description: Relates a work to its author, compiler, editor, artist or other entity responsible for its coming into existence in the form that it has.

identifiers.description: Relates the item to a unique system-generated identifier that governs interaction between systems and is regarded as canonical within the Wellcome data ecosystem.

subjects.description: Relates a work to the general thesaurus-based concept that describes the work's content.

genres.description: Relates a work to the genre that describes the work's content.

thumbnail.description: Relates any thing to the location of a representative thumbnail image

items.description: List of items related to this work.

production.description: Relates a work to its production events.

language.description: Relates a work to its primary language.

type.description: A broad, top-level description of the form of a work: namely, whether it is a printed book, archive, painting, photograph, moving image, etc.

Work.description: An individual work such as a text, archive item or picture; or a grouping of individual works (so, for instance, an archive collection counts as a work, as do all the series and individual files within it).  Each work may exist in multiple instances (e.g. copies of the same book).  N.B. this is not synonymous with \"work\" as that is understood in the International Federation of Library Associations and Institutions' Functional Requirements for Bibliographic Records model (FRBR) but represents something lower down the FRBR hierarchy, namely manifestation. Groups of related items are also included as works because they have similar properties to the individual ones.
